page.title: 04FARMING (CONTINUED)
page.content: {High House Farm (Continued) They sell their milk by bulk to dairies in{Birmingham.} The farm buildings are about 15 years old but the house itself is more than 100 years old. The worst season is Winter. Mr. Benyon and his wife are the only two people who work there. {Mr. Benyon is the owner of High House {Farm}and he enjoys working on his own. The cows give between 1 and 3 calves per year. The cows themselves weigh approx.,80 to 100 ponds each. The machinery the farm has is tractors, mowers,a baler,combine harvester,and a silage dispenser. They work 11 hours per day, seven days a week.
